intro: Ozoroa xylophylla, commonly known as the redwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its tall, straight trunk and can reach heights of up to 50 meters. Its leaves are alternate and simple, with a dark green color and a slightly hairy texture. Ozoroa xylophylla produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
